edu.arizona.biosemantics.semanticmarkup.markupelement.description.ling.learn.lib

Class PerlTerminologyLearner

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.arizona.biosemantics.semanticmarkup.markupelement.description.ling.learn.lib.PerlTerminologyLearner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITerminologyLearner
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatabaseInputFromEvaluationNoLearner, DatabaseInputNoLearner

    public class PerlTerminologyLearner
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITerminologyLearner
    PerlTerminologyLearner learns using the previous charaparser perl part The Markup run reads the results from the database tables populated by perl to continue the character level markup The description text that perl processes (from the temp folder) is what need to be updated if any normalization step is needed for various types of descriptions.
    Author:
    rodenhausen

      • writeTreatmentsToFiles

        private void writeTreatmentsToFiles(java.util.List<AbstractDescriptionsFile> descriptionsFiles,
                                    java.io.File directory)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Renames files other than the original input files to get a order for perl as input that is independent on the OS that CharaParser is run on. E.g. when iterating files in unix and windows it can be different Also, if a input descriptionsFile contains multiple descriptions we want to feed perl one description per file.
        Parameters:
        descriptionsFiles -
        directory -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
